headline: Royal Influencers’ Move May Cost British Brands
abstract: That sound you hear is hundreds of British brands biting their nails as the royal influencers depart.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle in May 2018, watched by a television audience of almost two billion viewers worldwide, was heralded by many as the ultimate 21st-century fairy tale. It was hoped that the union of a beautiful biracial American actress and one of the world’s favorite princes would firmly nudge the British royal family into a new era.
